title: Your guide to the men's Final Four: Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston (with picks!)
content: Here's how each team can win Saturday's semifinals, plus their potential flaws and predictions for both games.

title: Bird, Moore, Melo, Donovan lead '25 HOF class
content: Sue Bird, Maya Moore, Carmelo Anthony and Dwight Howard are among those selected for enshrinement into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

title: Staley: Bueckers hype dims S. Carolina's feats
content: South Carolina coach Dawn Staley questioned the narrative that has surrounded UConn guard Paige Bueckers and her quest to win a national championship, saying it has overshadowed any discussion about what her players have done.

title: Mourinho banned 3 games for nose grab incident
content: Fenerbahce manager Jose Mourinho has been banned for three matches and handed a fine of around 6,000 pounds ($7,734) after grabbing the nose of Galatasaray coach Okan Buruk in the Istanbul derby.

title: Red Sox's Campbell: 'Couldn't pass up' $60M deal
content: Red Sox rookie Kristian Campbell called his new eight-year, $60 million deal a "life-changing opportunity" and something he "couldn't pass up."

title: PSG wins record-extending 13th French title
content: Paris Saint-Germain beat Angers 1-0 and won a record-extending 13th Ligue 1 title without losing a game and with six matches to spare on Saturday.

title: Sources: Pitt transfer Lowe commits to Kentucky
content: Pitt guard Jaland Lowe, who entered the transfer portal after averaging over 16 points and five assists per game this season for the Panthers, has committed to Kentucky, sources told ESPN.

title: Basepath blunders help end Dodgers' unbeaten run
content: The Dodgers ran themselves out of a shot at keeping their undefeated season alive in a 3-2 loss to the Phillies that stuck them at 8-1 on the season.

title: 7-time Pro Bowl receiver Jones officially retires
content: Julio Jones, a seven-time Pro Bowler who is the Falcons' all-time leader in receptions and receiving yards, has retired. He last played for the Eagles in 2023.

title: Ovechkin's NHL journey through eight eras
content: Witness Ovi's evolution from rock star rookie to "young gun" to Cup winner to chasing Gretzky (and much more).

title: How UConn, South Carolina advanced to the NCAA title game -- and first look at the final
content: South Carolina and UConn advanced to Sunday's NCAA title game. We tracked all the action live from Tampa.

title: With 798 wins, Houston's Kelvin Sampson is after his first title -- but his legacy is cemented
content: With the second-most wins of any active coach without a national championship, Sampson has his best chance yet.

title: Duke's baton now fully passed from Coach K to Jon Scheyer
content: Mike Krzyzewski's emergence from the shadows is the ultimate sign that the program truly belongs to Scheyer.

title: 'What the heck have we done?' Inside 48 hours of torpedo bat madness
content: From a comment on a Yankees broadcast to a rush of new bat orders, here's how MLB's hottest trend took off.

title: Why Bird, Fowles and Moore are Hall of Famers -- and the greatest class of women yet
content: Sue Bird, Sylvia Fowles and Maya Moore were first-ballot selections who make up an unprecedented class.

title: NHL playoff watch: What's at stake in all 13 games on Saturday
content: Wild card and playoff seeds remain up in the air. Here are updated bracket, draft lottery projections.

title: What's next for UCLA, Texas? Forecasting next season for women's March Madness top seeds
content: From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to next season for the Bruins and Longhorns after their Final Four exits.

title: Arsenal had an eye on Real Madrid at Everton, but draw puts title out of sight
content: If the title battle has been a one-horse race for some time, this was the day Arsenal surrendered any hope of pipping Liverpool at the finishing post.

title: Müller to leave Bayern Munich at end of season
content: Thomas Müller will leave Bayern Munich at the end of the season, ending a 25-year career with the club, after not being offered a new contract.

title: NWSL eyes expansion: Can be 'size of the NFL'
content: National Women's Soccer League commissioner Jessica Berman said Friday that she thinks the league could grow to be the size of the NFL, which has 32 teams.

title: USSF chief backs 48-team Women's WC in 2031
content: U.S. Soccer CEO JT Batson said the federation would strongly support expansion of the Women's World Cup to 48 teams in 2031.

title: Depleted U.S. to experiment in Olympic rematch
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes said she feels confident in her team's defensive personnel ahead of an Olympic gold medal-game rematch against Brazil, despite the "extremely unfortunate" injury to center-back Tierna Davidson.

title: Amorim: 'Crazy' to believe Man Utd could win Prem
content: Ruben Amorim said he would be "crazy" to think Manchester United can win the Premier League next season.

title: Musiala joins 'crazy' Bayern injury list for Inter QF
content: Jamal Musiala is set to miss the first leg of Bayern Munich's Champions League quarterfinal against Inter Milan on Tuesday, adding to the Bundesliga side's injury woes at a crucial stage of the season.

title: Ronaldo double gives Al Nassr Riyadh derby win
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice in the second half, including a penalty, to guide Al-Nassr to a 3-1 win over Al-Hilal in the race for the Saudi Pro League title on Friday.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Long snapper rehearses business pitch for Deion Sanders, teammates
content: Camden Dempsey, who launched an insurance company on Thursday, got some extra help in a team meeting.

title: Johni Broome could be 'the most impactful transfer in college basketball history'
content: The SEC Player of the Year is chasing history -- for himself and Auburn -- as the Tigers head into the Final Four.

title: From 2008 to 2025: Trends from the last all-No. 1 seed men's Final Four
content: This year marks just the second time since the dawn of men's NCAA tournament seeding that all Final Four teams will be top seeds.

title: Main characters of March Madness 2025: Standouts from every round
content: From viral moments to game winners, here's a look at who has defined the men's and women's tournaments.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gyökeres could be available for £55M
content: Manchester United and Arsenal are eyeing a possible move for Sporting CP's Viktor Gyökeres. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Waqf Bill, Cleared By Parliament After Heated Debates, Gets President's Nod
content: President Droupadi Murmu has given her assent to the Waqf (Amendment) Bill which was passed by both houses of parliament after heated debates.

title: Air Force Instructor Suffers Injuries During Parachute Jump In Agra, Dies
content: The Indian Air Force has suffered its second big loss in four days after a Para Jump Instructor died because of injuries sustained during a training exercise in Agra on Saturday. The pilot of a Jaguar fighter jet had died on Wednesday after the aircr

title: "Hang Tough, It Won't Be Easy": Donald Trump To Americans Amid Tariff War
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday doubled down on the sweeping tariffs he unleashed on countries around the world, vowing that his "economic revolution" will yield historic results for Americans.

title: Walk On Knees, Lick Coins: Firm's Punishment For Underperforming Employees
content: A private marketing firm here has been accused of subjecting its underperforming employees to degrading treatment, including making them walk on their knees like chained dogs and lick coins from the floor.

title: BJP MP Backs Piyush Goyal's Take On Startups, Calls Zepto CEO's Reply...
content: BJP MP Praveen Khandelwal criticized Zepto chief executive Aadit Palicha's response to Union Minister Piyush Goyal's comments on Indian startups as "misplaced and illogical".

title: Viral Video Shows Woman Thrashing Mother-In-Law, Dragging Her By Hair
content: A video of a woman thrashing her mother-in-law in Madhya Pradesh has gone viral with her husband now fearing for his and his mother's life in light of the grisly Meerut murder.

title: "Strong Country, Weak Reaction": Zelensky Slams US After Russian Attack
content: In a heartfelt and emotional statement on social media, Zelenskyy criticised the US for its perceived weakness in addressing the attack, which resulted in the deaths of 19 people, including nine children.

title: MS Dhoni Retirement Speculation: CSK Coach Spills The Beans
content: Dhoni's parents' presence saw social media speculating whether the CSK great would retire or not after the match against DC

title: 17-Year-Old Dies By Suicide At Mall In Mohali, Jumps From 4th Floor
content: A 17-year-old boy has died by suicide after jumping from the fourth floor of a popular mall in Mohali.

title: "Midwest Burnin' In Your Dumpster Fire": China AI Videos Mock Trump Tariffs
content: China's state-run media has taken to the internet with AI-generated videos, featuring dancing robots and fraught consumers, to chide US President Donald Trump and tariffs they say threaten high inflation and economic distress for Americans.

title: PCB Breaks Silence After Khushdil Attacks Spectator During PAK-NZ 3rd ODI
content: There was an alleged use of inappropriate remarks against Pakistan players by a group of Afghan spectators during the third ODI against New Zealand.

title: Why PM Modi's Grand Welcome In Colombo Is A First For Any Foreign Leader
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Saturday accorded a grand ceremonial welcome at the historic Independence Square in the heart of the Sri Lankan capital, in perhaps the first such honour given to a foreign leader.

title: "Oops": Trump Shares Video Showing Deadly Strike On Houthis In Yemen
content: Resembling images shot from military drones or other loitering aircraft, the black-and-white footage Trump posted to his Truth Social network shows several dozen human figures from an almost vertical angle.

title: US Moves Largest B-2 Bomber Fleet, 3 Aircraft Carriers To Indo-Pacific
content: While the world was busy figuring out Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff move and its fallout, the United States quietly made a massive military move in the Indian Ocean and Indo-Pacific region.

title: Meghalaya 10th Board Result 2025 Out, Massive 31% Jump In Pass Percentage
content: MBOSE SSLC Result 2025 Out: Out of 63,682 students who appeared for the exam, 55,473 have passed, recording a pass percentage of 87.10%, a substantial rise from last year's pass percentage of 55.80%.

title: Trump-Freed Drug Convict Arrested Again For Assaulting 3-Year-Old
content: Jonathan Braun, 41, from Nassau County, has been accused of punching a man during a dinner at his home. After arguing with the man, he shoved his three-year-old child to the ground, according to the complaint.

title: Opinion: Why Does Your AI 'Ghibli' Look So Terrible? Because It Is
content: What happens when AI conjures art out of thin air while completely isolating the user from the process? You get what is, essentially, just an artefact, minus the artistry. A hunk of butter that's all hunk and no butter.

title: US may slip into recession by 2025-end due to Trump tariffs: JP Morgan
content: J P Morgan projects a US recession by the end of 2025, attributing it to President Trump's new reciprocal tariffs. The forecast indicates a potential GDP decline and higher unemployment. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell echoed the concerns, highlighting that tariffs may cause higher inflation and slower growth.

title: IPL: Blazing Yashasvi, fiery Archer sink Punjab Kings in Mullanpur
content: Rajasthan Royals secured a convincing 50-run victory over Punjab Kings, largely due to Yashasvi Jaiswal’s impressive 67 runs and Jofra Archer’s impactful bowling. Archer’s aggressive spell resulted in crucial wickets, restricting Punjab to 155/9 in 20 overs and ensuring Rajasthan’s dominant win. Jaiswal’s 89-run stand with Sanju Samson (38 off 26) put RR in control early. And after both departed, Riyan Parag (43* off 25) and Shimron Hetmyer (20 off 12) ensured the momentum never dipped, powering the Royals past the 200-run mark.

title: BJP protests over worker’s suicide in Karnataka, wants 2 Cong MLAs named in FIR
content: BJP staged a protest in Kushalnagar, Kodagu, demanding the inclusion of two Congress MLAs in the FIR related to Vinay Somaiah's alleged suicide. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Home Minister G Parameshwara dismissed BJP’s demands, emphasizing a proper police investigation without yielding to political pressure.

title: Elon Musk believes the 'biggest threat’ to US citizens is…
content: Elon Musk highlighted concerns over US government debt, backing author Scott Adams' view on rising dangers. Musk, leading DOGE to reduce federal spending waste, faces political resistance. Reports suggest Trump hints at Musk's exit from the role were refuted by Musk as 'fake news'.

title: Uttarakhand: Miyanwala not tied to Mughals, do not rename it, say locals
content: Residents of Dehradun's Miyanwala area, predominantly from the Rajput community, are opposing the proposal to rename the area as Ramjiwala, citing its deep historical significance. They emphasize that the name does not have Mughal connections but rather honors their ancestral heritage.

title: Microsoft VP praises DeepMind’s new models, tells staff: 'Don't come to me for ... '
content: Microsoft AI VP Nando de Freitas acknowledged Google's DeepMind for its new AI models while addressing restrictive employment contracts at DeepMind. He received multiple requests for help from distressed DeepMind employees regarding notice periods and noncompete agreements but directed them to internal leadership instead.

title: Cab driver helps woman deliver baby in Gurugram, hailed online as 'real Vikas'
content: In Gurugram, a Rapido driver named Vikas assisted in the delivery of a baby inside his cab, ensuring both mother and newborn's safety. He then drove them to the hospital and only charged the standard fare. His kindness was shared on Reddit, with users urging recognition and appreciation for his selfless act.

title: Rahul Gandhi 'acting against' India's interests, says BJP's Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: Kerala BJP president Rajeev Chandrasekhar has accused Congress leader Rahul Gandhi of misusing the Constitution for spreading lies and acting against India's interests. Chandrasekhar also slammed Congress MPs for allegedly inciting communal hatred during the Waqf (Amendment) Bill debate and praised PM Modi for making Waqf land more accessible to the poor.

title: LeBron left stunned as Lakers teammates ignore injury in shocking loss to Warriors
content: LeBron James appeared injured in the Lakers' 116-123 loss to the Warriors, raising concerns about team chemistry. The Warriors, boosted by Jimmy Butler's addition, are surging, while the Lakers, despite acquiring Luka Doncic and Anthony Davis, struggle with inconsistency. With playoffs approaching, Lakers must address their defensive lapses and team cohesion.

title: Omar Abdullah govt backs quota review outside, opposes it in court
content: The Omar Abdullah government faces criticism for requesting the HC to dismiss a petition challenging J&K’s high reservation policy, which limits access for open merit candidates. Minister Sakina Itoo suggested the affidavit was an error, promising a fresh one and affirming the government's commitment to reviewing the reservation system.

title: Sanjay Raut says Shiv Sena (UBT) won't move SC against Waqf Bill
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut announced that the party will not contest the Waqf Amendment Bill, 2025, in the Supreme Court, considering the matter closed. While the Shiv Sena (UBT) steps back, other leaders including AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi and Congress leader Mohammad Jawed have already filed petitions challenging the Bill.

title: BSF foils infiltration bid, shoots dead Pak intruder along intl border in Jammu
content: Alert BSF forces thwarted an infiltration attempt, killing a Pakistani intruder crossing into the RS Pura sector of Jammu. Despite warnings, the intruder persisted and was shot dead. A flag meeting with Pakistan Rangers followed, who refused to accept the body. Security officials are enhancing measures in the region.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Pamban rail bridge, other projects in TN: Key details
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is visiting Tamil Nadu to inaugurate India's first vertical lift sea bridge in Rameswaram and launch major infrastructure projects worth Rs 8,300 crore. He will also offer prayers at Ramanathaswamy Temple and address a public gathering.

title: 'Irrelevant': CSK's Fleming reacts to criticism on Ashwin’s YT channel
content: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming dismissed criticism on Ravichandran Ashwin's YouTube channel following their defeat to DC. The comments questioned the choice of playing spinner Noor Ahmad over veterans. Fleming remained unperturbed, emphasizing the team's focus on on-field performance. CSK's loss marked their third consecutive defeat in IPL 2025, intensifying mid-table pressure.

title: Will Ja Morant play tonight against the Detroit Pistons? Latest update injury report
content: Ja Morant of the Memphis Grizzlies is set to play against the Detroit Pistons, providing a much-needed boost for his team amidst their playoff push. Despite recent controversies and fines for inappropriate gestures, Morant's return may prove pivotal as the Grizzlies seek a crucial victory. The game will be broadcast at 7 p.m. ET on FDSDET, FDSSE, and NBA TV.

title: 'It won’t be easy': Trump asks Americans to 'hang tough' amid trade war
content: President Trump has reiterated his tariff policies, asserting that China has borne a heavier impact than the US in their trade conflict. Following China's imposition of reciprocal tariffs, Trump emphasized the alleged economic benefits and job growth in the United States, while dismissing China's retaliatory measures as a sign of panic.

title: 'Not my role to put an end to it': Fleming on Dhoni retirement buzz
content: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming dismissed speculations about MS Dhoni's retirement, emphasising it’s not his role to decide Dhoni's IPL career's end. Fleming praised Dhoni's enduring performance despite a challenging match against Delhi Capitals, highlighting tough batting conditions and the need for stronger top-order contributions to support the power hitters.

title: Dhoni, Shankar create unwanted records in CSK's sluggish chase vs DC
content: Chennai Super Kings lost to Delhi Capitals by 25 runs in their IPL 2025 match. Chasing 184, CSK struggled at 74/5 when MS Dhoni entered. Dhoni and Vijay Shankar added a slow 84-run partnership, failing to accelerate. KL Rahul's 77 off 51 balls powered Delhi to 183/6, maintaining their unbeaten run while CSK's campaign falters.

title: KL Rahul masterclass powers DC to historic win over CSK at Chepauk
content: KL Rahul's 77 off 51 anchored Delhi Capitals' win over Chennai Super Kings by 25 runs, marking their first victory at Chepauk in 15 years. Despite early setbacks, DC posted 183/6. CSK stumbled during their chase, with disciplined bowling from DC limiting them to 158/5. DC secured their third consecutive win, strengthening their position as early title contenders.

title: History! DC finally break 15-year curse against CSK in Chennai
content: Delhi Capitals achieved a historic win over Chennai Super Kings at MA Chidambaram Stadium after 15 years, marking their third consecutive IPL 2025 victory. KL Rahul's 77 and a solid team effort led to a 25-run win, pushing DC to the top of the points table, while CSK faced their third straight defeat.

title: Sanju Samson captains Rajasthan Royals for the first time in IPL 2025
content: Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer decided to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals in their IPL 2025 clash at Mullanpur. Rajasthan welcomed back Sanju Samson as captain while pacer Tushar Deshpande missed the fixture due to a niggle, with Yudhvir Singh Charak included as his replacement. Pacer Tushar Deshpande missed the fixture due to a niggle, and Yudhvir Singh Charak was included in the XI as his replacement.

title: Watch: Pandya struggles to hold back emotions after LSG defeat
content: Hardik Pandya was emotional after Mumbai Indians lost a close IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants by 12 runs. Pandya's career-best performance with the ball (5/36) had restricted LSG to 203/8, but MI fell short despite strong contributions from Suryakumar Yadav, Naman Dhir, and Tilak Varma, struggling to find boundaries in the final overs.

title: 'Over Rs 29cr spent ...': BJP's fresh attack on Kejriwal in 'Sheesh Mahal' row
content: Delhi BJP chief Virendra Sachdeva accused former CM Arvind Kejriwal of having an extravagant lifestyle at the taxpayers' expense, presenting RTI data showing an average annual maintenance cost of over Rs 3.69 crore for his official residence from 2015 to 2022. The AAP has yet to respond to the allegations.

title: Eye on China: India, UAE & Sri Lanka to develop energy hub
content: India, UAE, and Sri Lanka have signed an agreement to develop Trincomalee as an energy hub, during PM Modi’s visit to Colombo. The project will involve a multi-product pipeline and utilization of an old oil tank farm. The collaboration is seen as a strategic move to counter China’s growing influence in Sri Lanka.

title: Karnataka 2nd PUC result 2025 on karresults.nic.in: When and how to check
content: The Karnataka 2nd PUC Result 2025 is expected to be announced in April. Students can check their results online via the official websites, karresults.nic.in and kseab.karnataka.gov.in/english. The result will be provisional, and the original mark sheet will be provided by schools. Following past trends, the results are typically declared in April, with the announcement expected around mid-month. Students should stay updated on the official websites for further details.

title: Digvesh Rathi: From watching Narine videos to becoming Pant’s ace
content: Digvesh Singh Rathi’s bowling career transformed after being rejected at the Delhi and District Cricket Association trials. Driven by the goal to avoid conceding sixes, Rathi honed his skills in local games. His persistence paid off when he was picked by Lucknow Super Giants in IPL, impressing with his economical bowling and determination.

title: Celebs attend Manoj Kumar's funeral: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Celebrities attended Manoj Kumar's state funeral, dignifying his patriotic legacy. RJ Mahvash sparked dating rumors with Yuzvendra Chahal through a supportive video. Saif Ali Khan’s stabbing case intensified as the accused's bail was denied. Vin Diesel shared a throwback photo with Deepika Padukone, exciting fans. Tony Kakkar's new song, linked to Samay Raina, continues to stir discussions.

title: Meerut murder: Custody battle for 6-yr-old daughter intensifies
content: Six-year-old Pihu’s future is uncertain as a custody battle ensues between the families of her deceased father, ex-merchant navy officer Saurabh Rajput, and her accused mother, Muskan Rastogi. While her maternal grandparents care for her, her paternal uncle seeks legal custody. Muskan allegedly murdered Saurabh with her lover, making the situation even more complex.

title: Delhi govt rolls out Centre's Ayushman Bharat scheme
content: Delhi's BJP-led administration has partnered with the central government to adopt the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana. The healthcare scheme will provide eligible Delhi households with annual health insurance worth Rs 10 lakh. This makes Delhi the 35th state/Union Territory to implement this health programme.

title: Indian Navy ensures no nation suppresses another in IOR : Rajnath
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh emphasized India's role in maintaining peace and stability in the Indian Ocean Region amid China's strategic presence. The Indian Navy's launch of the 'Indian Ocean ship (IOS) Sagar' underscores India's commitment to secure navigation and shared interests. With a diverse crew visiting various ports, it reflects India's dedication to collective security and prosperity.

title: 'Naxalism will be eradicated from India by March 2026': Amit Shah in Bastar
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that Naxalism will be eradicated in India by March 2026, highlighting the BJP government's ongoing efforts. Over 880 Naxals surrendered in 2024, with promises to reintegrate those who lay down arms. Shah emphasized development in Bastar and honored tribal artists for their cultural contributions.

title: Netanyahu planning to visit Trump to negotiate 17% tariff: Report
content: Israel tried to avoid the tariffs by announcing that it would lift all tariffs on US products. But Trump announced a 17 per cent tariff on Isreal.If Netanyahu meets Trump in the White House on Monday, he will be the first foreign leader to visit Trump in person to negotiate on tariffs.

title: Sikandar box office collection day 7: Salman Khan's Eid release earns only Rs 1.53 crore
content: Salman Khan’s much-anticipated Eid release Sikandar, also starring Rashmika Mandanna, is having a tough run at the box office. Despite the festive release on March 30 and high expectations, the film has struggled to cross the Rs 100 crore milestone in its first week, a figure it was expected to surpass with ease. On day 7 (Saturday), early estimates indicate a net collection of Rs 2.1 crore across all languages.

title: IPL: How much has Digvesh Rathi been fined for celebrating?
content: Digvesh Rathi, a spinner for Lucknow Super Giants, has stirred controversy in IPL 2025 with his provocative 'notebook' celebration. After being fined for unsportsmanlike conduct against the Punjab Kings, he repeated the gesture against Mumbai Indians, facing increased penalties. Rathi has been fined Rs 5,62,500 and accumulated three demerit points, sparking debate on player conduct.

title: Janet Jones recalls Wayne Gretzky's locker room speech before USA-Canada 4 Nations finals
content: Wayne Gretzky’s locker room speech fired up Team Canada, who won the 4 Nations Face-Off final. However, some fans criticized his perceived closeness with Donald Trump, leading to public backlash. Despite the controversy, Gretzky’s contributions to hockey and his love for Canada remain undisputed.

title: MS Dhoni to retire? Legends’ parents make rare appearance at Chepauk
content: Speculation about MS Dhoni's retirement intensified as his parents and wife attended the match against the Delhi Capitals at Chepauk Stadium. With the emotional backdrop at his home ground, fans are wondering if this might be his farewell game in the IPL. Dhoni has featured in 267 IPL matches, batting in 232 innings and amassing 5,289 runs at an impressive average of 39.18 and a strike rate of 137.70.

title: Cash row: Justice Varma takes oath as Allahabad HC judge, but won't get work
content: Justice Yashwant Varma took oath as a judge of Allahabad high court despite an ongoing in-house inquiry over semi-burnt cash recovered from his residence. There's no judicial work assigned for now. A PIL was filed to halt the ceremony, and the legal fraternity criticized the decision, urging the Chief Justice to reconsider until the investigation concludes.

title: Watch: Khushdil attacks spectator after anti-Pakistan taunts
content: After Pakistan's 3-0 ODI loss to New Zealand, Khushdil Shah faced verbal abuse from Afghan spectators, leading to a confrontational incident. The situation was defused when officials ejected the disruptive fans. Pakistan's loss was marked by the batting collapse and Ben Sears' remarkable 5/34 performance. PCB's response emphasized the need to maintain respect in cricket.

title: 'It's fine': Kamra reacts to Shiv Sena's 'BookMyShow removed him' claim
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra queries BookMyShow about his removal from their list of artists following controversial remarks against Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde. This comes after Shiv Sena's Rahool Kanal thanked BookMyShow for removing Kamra, highlighting the conflict where Shiv Sainiks vandalized Kamra's performance studio.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has defended the intense work ethic required for startup success, emphasizing that employees needed to continue working after family dinners during the company's early days. Hoffman argues that work-life balance is not feasible in startups, highlighting the significant rewards for those who embrace the demanding culture.

title: Rebuilding the bridge to Rameswaram
content: The new sea bridge at Pamban is all set to be dedicated to the nation by Prime Minister Narendra Modi today. What is the technology the new bridge works on? How different is it from the old bridge, and why the old bridge had to be decommissioned...S. Sundar asks these questions and more, and finds answers to them

title: Our govt. intends to follow J&K Reorganisation Act, says Omar Abdullah’s adviser
content: NC leader Nasir Aslam Wani’s statement comes a day after J&K Lieutenant-Governor Manoj Sinha defends transfer of 48 officials

title: IIMK launches 18th batch of EPGP
content: The two-year management programme meant for working professionals combines the flexibility of online interactive learning with on-campus modules

title: Two bird sanctuaries in Tamil Nadu part of first-of-its-kind ICMR study to track zoonotic diseases
content: The inter-Ministerial study, which aims to track the risks posed by the interconnectedness of forest ecosystems, avian populations, and local human communities, could help monitor areas of increased bird-human interactions more effectively, say experts

title: CPI(M) keen on improving quality of membership, not quantity
content: Deviations from the set norms of the party have also been observed among members in many States, according to the report, which says that a rectification process will be launched soon after the party congress is over

title: CPI(M) party congress to conclude on April 6; M.A. Baby tipped to be new general secretary
content: A section of leaders, especially from West Bengal, want Ashok Dhawale, Polit Bureau member and president of the All India Kisan Sabha, to lead the party

title: President Murmu gives assent to Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025
content: The bill was passed by Parliament after three days of intense debate in both the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha.

title: Kunal Kamra failed to appear before Mumbai police for third time
content: Khar police booked Mr. Kamra after Shiv Sena MLA Murji Patel registered a complaint for allegedly making defamatory remarks against Eknath Shinde

title: CPI(M) asks Centre to restore full statehood to J&K
content: The resolution said the unconstitutional abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A had dismembered and downgraded the State, with its bifurcation into Union Territories (UTs) creating a deep political void

title: Students should acquire knowledge to mould their character: SC Judge
content: Union government should increase the allocation of funds for education, which is under the Concurrent list, from the existing 3% of GDP to 6%, to enrol more rural students in higher education, says VIT chancellor G. Viswanathan

title: Bereaved family alleges police role in M.P. decomposed bodies case; officer removed, probe ordered
content: Victim’s older children allege that police killed their father and siblings; local protestors seek CBI probe, collector recommends judicial probe; officer Ankita Sulya removed from duty after complaints

title: Govt. must take stakeholders and political parties into confidence on U.S. tariffs, says Congress
content: India’s response to U.S. tariffs should keep national interests foremost, says former Commerce Minister Anand Sharma

title: Parliamentary committee seeks reform of ASI monument delisting protocols
content: This comes amid the controversy over demands for removal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb’s grave, an ASI protected monument, in Maharashtra

title: Climate envoys from EU discuss climate action with Indian officials
content: The evironmental high-level talks come on the margins of a meeting between the Prime Minister and the European Commission in February, and the upcoming COP30 in November

title: Rajasthan seeking GI tag for more farm, spice crops
content: Inter-departmental committee to identify prospective GI candidates; State government expects GI tag to boost demand for these products, increase farmers’ profits, and prevent counterfeits

title: Kunal Kamra row: People shouldn’t misuse their rights in a democracy, says Shinde
content: He hints at Uddhav group’s involvement in the incident and adds that he does not support the violence at the studio

title: WAVES anime and manga contest showcases emerging talents
content: WAVES is a ‘first-of-its-kind summit, uniting films, OTT platforms, gaming, comics, digital media, AI, and the burgeoning AVGC-XR (Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality) sector under one roof’

title: Pune Hospital denies insensitivity, says no deposit to be taken from emergency patients
content: The chief doctor of Deenanath Hospital, where a woman died during a delivery, said that when the hospital was started, no deposits were taken

title: West Bengal’s job aspirants call for a march to State secretariat on April 21
content: This comes as almost 26,000 candidates’ careers remain uncertain after Supreme Court order scraps their employment

title: Kerala launches digital payment system in govt. hospitals
content: System enables payments for services at health centres Statewide using credit cards, debit cards, and UPI. In the initial phase, 313 hospitals will offer the facility

title: Akal Takht chief priest demands special law on desecration of Guru Granth Sahib
content: He added that similar legal protections should be made for the holy ‘Granths’ of other religions, to ensure that no one dares to harm the beliefs of any religion

title: Tamil Nadu Congress leader Gopanna contributes 7,000 photographs for website on Nehru
content: The senior vice-president of the Tamil Nadu Congress Committee has collected thousands of rare and old photographs of India’s first Prime Minister and others in the Gandhi family

title: V. Somanna inspects ongoing Road Over Bridge work between Padarayanapura and Hosahalli
content: The new ROB, being built at a cost of ₹12 crore, will replace the old structure that has completed its codal life.

title: Lost in translation
content: A school in Maharashtra’s tribal-dominated district Gadchiroli is caught between two laws, resulting in litigation. Started by the Gond tribe four years ago to further their language and culture, there is now fear that it will be shut down. Snehal Mutha speaks to the community on their hopes for the school

title: The pen that challenged, the voice that endured
content: ‘Sarah Josephinte Lokangal’, two-day programme, celebrates 60 years of the writers works, life and resistance

title: No likely settlement in sight for protesting ASHAs
content: State govt. going ahead with the setting up of a committee to study their issues, as suggested in the conciliatory talks on Thursday

title: Will end poverty in Uttar Pradesh within three years, CM Yogi Adityanath says
content: Speaking about the Waqf Amendment Bill, the U.P. CM said that it would end illegal occupation and looting of land in the name of waqf

title: Andhra Pradesh aqua farmers on the edge as U.S. tariff hike comes into effect from April 5 midnight
content: Officials say seafood products stranded in various ports in the U.S. or are in transit will attract old tariff; Seafood Exporters’ Association of India leaders plan to meet the Prime Minister and the Union Commerce and Finance Ministers to explain them about the crisis triggered in the sector

title: Breast cancer most prevalent among cancers recorded in Bhalabhadrapuram, says MLA Nallamilli
content: 62 among the 1,295 persons in the village who underwent cancer screening by RMC experts tested positive for seven types of cancers; bureaucrats, medical, health, and APPCB officials tried to downplay the incidence of cancer cases, says the Anaparthi legislator

title: Panchamasalis to train priests in ‘Basava Tatva’
content: The Akhila Bharath Lingayat Panchamasali Samaj Trust has decided to give training to the priests of the Panchamasali community to conduct various functions as per ‘Basava Tatva’ (tenet) shunning vedic rituals.

title: U.S. Vice-President Vance and NSA Waltz set to visit India this month
content: Vance to be accompanied by his wife and children to heritage spots during the ‘largely private’ tour, officials say; Waltz will hold talks with NSA Doval on the successor mechanism to the India-U.S. Initiative for Critical and Emerging Technologies

title: BIS Hubballi raids Flipkart’s logistics arm in Dharwad, seizes articles worth ₹1.3 crore
content: The seized items included air conditioners, mixer grinders, storage water heaters, sewing machines, footwear, and other goods

title: Trinamool’s Abhishek Banerjee serves legal notice to ISF MLA Nawsad Siddique
content: In the legal notice, Mr. Banerjee’s advocate accused the MLA of “misleading the fellow Muslim population and the people of West Bengal” into thinking he was “absent” during Waqf Bill vote

title: Hastily pulled down Organiser article on Christian properties triggers a political storm in Kerala
content: The article suggested that the land owned by the Catholic Church in India far surpassed Waqf properties in the country. Kerala CM, Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan responded by stating that the article testified to the RSS’s impending move to wrest control of Church properties.

title: Don’t impose Telugu: students, parents to Telangana govt.
content: A gathering of non–Telugu students, parents and representatives from various schools said policy must be flexible so that they can choose the second language that aligns with their needs, interests and future aspirations

title: Jabalpur attack: Minister says priests have expressed gratitude for Kerala govt.’s support
content: The Congress is behind the attack on priests in Jabalpur, alleges former Union Minister  V. Muraleedharan

title: PM Modi lays wreath at IPKF memorial in Colombo; hails fallen warriors
content: India had lost around 1,200 soldiers during the IPKF's stay in Sri Lanka between July 1987 and March 1990

title: Telangana government flags ‘AI-generated fake content’ over Kancha Gachibowli land controversy shared by Union Minister and celebrities
content: The Chief Minister expressing concern compared the spread of AI-generated misinformation as “digital pandemic” worse than COVID-19 and urged the officials to pursue legal action and bolster cybercrime defences to counter misinformation orders

title: Eleven militia members of CPI(Maoist) surrender before Alluri Sitharama Raju district police in Andhra Pradesh
content: They have given up arms as they are vexed with the outdated ideology of the Maoists and attracted by the government’s welfare schemes, says Superintendent of Police Amit Bardar

title: Satheesan asks Shaija Andavan to quit her post
content: A police case has been registered against her for allegedly praising Nathuram Godse, Mahatma Gandhi’s assassin, in a social media post

title: Simultaneous polls will boost economic growth, eliminate administrative disruptions: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: According to Sitharaman, simultaneous polls should be approached with national interest as a priority, free from political bias

title: Service charge in restaurants: to pay or not to pay?
content: Service staff at many city-based restaurants say these charges and tips are not mere perks but a necessity

title: Tejashwi Yadav promises not to implement Waqf Bill in Bihar if voted to power
content: Yadav says the BJP wants to end rights and privileges of the exploited and deprived people while JD(U) works as an anti-minority cell of the BJP

title: Community leaders to appeal to Panchamasali seer not to speak in favour of any individual or political party
content: Basava Jaya Mruthyunjaya Swami has been making statements in favour of expelled BJP leader Basanagouda Patil Yatnal

title: De Bruyne to leave Man City at end of season
content: Kevin De Bruyne has announced that he will leave the club at the end of the season . the england international's contract at the Etihad Stadium expires in the summer . he said on friday that the club will leave as a free agent .

title: Jets take over the top spot, plus every team's performance vs. projections
content: the blues beat the Penguins for their 11th win in a row . there are less than two weeks left in the 2024-25 NHL regular season . the playoff field continues to be whittled down, with teams clinching berths .
